sources.title: Evidence
sources.placeholder: Add Sources for publication to class

text: Here are resources you can choose to distribute to your students as they work their way through chapters.
To make these available in the students' Resource Library tab,

• drag the tile (link, image, text, etc.) into your own Workspace on the right, and
  • press the Publish button (rectangle with the up arrow)
CHAPTER 1 SOURCES
Evidence 1: The Effects of Stress on the Heart (video)
Questions About Evidence 1:
1. The subordinate monkey has:
Less control OR More control (underline your choice)
2. The subordinate monkey artery is:
Less clogged OR More clogged (underline your choice)
3. Both monkeys had the same diet and health care, the difference in their blood vessels is only due to the stress from social subordination.
True OR False ? (underline your choice)
Welcome to the Bio4Community CLUE Teacher Guide
Student access to Bio4Community Stress Stories
Each small group in your classroom will read one of the three Bio4Community Stress Stories.

To get started, create a class for each small group in the Concord portal. You will create a unique access code for your students, called the "Class Word". Give each group their class word and have them register for accounts at https://learn.concord.org. Then contact Frieda (freichsman@concord.org) who will assign the chapters for the stories to each group for you. You will then be able to release each Chapter to each group in sequence.
The Student Resource Library

Each chapter of the three stories (Rakesh, Estrella, and Felix) is accompanied by a Resource Library for students. When you are ready, you will publish the list so the students can see it and access the Resources.
To publish the Resource Library List for each Chapter:

• Drag the list from your Resource Library tab (left side of screen) to your Workspace (right-hand side of screen)
  • There you can edit the list, if you wish, before publishing them to the Class.
  • Click the Publish button at the upper left of the Workspace. Note: everything in your Workspace will be published to the students' Resource Library tab. Make sure to tailor the Workspace to what you want to publish.
Introducing the Stories

Tell the students that we are trying something a bit different. Instead of just giving them evidence in a packet like we did for short term stress, we are giving them a story, and different groups have different stories. The stories follow a main character as they try to figure out a health issue that is making them concerned. The characters encounter evidence along the way and use it to figure out the issue.
They should work as a team and assign the cast. The narrator has a lot to read. Other roles have much less.
They should answer the questions and fill in the table in their Workspace.
CHAPTER 1 SOURCES
Evidence 1: The Effects of Stress on the Heart (video)
CHAPTER 2 SOURCES
• Evidence 2: All the Fuss About Cholesterol (blog post)
• Questions About Evidence 2:
1. Our body can make all the cholesterol we need.
• True OR False ? (underline your choice)
2. Cholesterol is needed to build cells, make vitamins, and make hormones.
• True OR False ? (underline your choice)
3. A cholesterol plaque can form in:
• A. The liver B. Inside the blood vessel wall C. The stomach (underline your choice)

Chapter 1 of Each Story:

Tell the students that we are trying something a bit different. Instead of just giving them evidence in a packet like we did for short term stress, we are giving them a story, and different groups have different stories. The stories follow a main character as they try to figure out a health issue that is making them concerned. The characters encounter evidence along the way and use it to figure out the issue.
They should work as a team and assign the cast. The narrator has a lot to read. Other roles have much less.

CHAPTER 3 SOURCES
Evidence 1: The Effects of Stress on the Heart (video)
Evidence 2: All the Fuss About Cholesterol (blog post)
Evidence 3: Rakesh Sharma Blood Test Report

  • Click the Publish button at the upper left of the Workspace. Note: everything in your Workspace will be published to the students' Resource Library tab. Make sure to tailor the Workspace to what you want to publish.
Chapter 1 of Each Story:

Tell the students that we are trying something a bit different. Instead of just giving them evidence in a packet like we did for short term stress, we are giving them a story, and different groups have different stories. The stories follow a main character as they try to figure out a health issue that is making them concerned. The characters encounter evidence along the way and use it to figure out the issue.
They should work as a team and assign the cast. The narrator has a lot to read. Other roles have much less.
They should answer the questions and fill in the table in their Workspace.
CHAPTER 4 SOURCES

Here are resources you can choose to distribute to your students as they work their way through chapters. To make these available in the Resource Library tab, drag the information (link, image, text, etc.) into your own Workspace and press the Publish button (rectangle with the up arrow).

Evidence 4: Nose Animation
Welcome to the Bio4Community CLUE Teacher Guide!
Student access to Bio4Community Stress Stories
Each small group in your classroom will read one of the three Bio4Community Stress Stories.

To get started, create a class for each small group in the Concord portal. You will create an access code for your students, called the "Class Word". Give each group their class word and have them register for accounts at https://learn.concord.org. Then contact Frieda (freichsman@concord.org) who will assign the chapters for the stories to each group for you. You will then be able to release each Chapter to each group at will.
The Student Resource Library

Each chapter of the three stories (Rakesh, Estrella, and Felix) is accompanied by a Resource Library for students. When you are ready, you will publish the list so the students can see it and access the Resources.
To publish the Resource Library List for each Chapter:

• Drag the list from your Resource Library tab (left side of screen) to your Workspace (right-hand side of screen)
  • There you can edit the list, if you wish, before publishing them to the Class.
  • Click the Publish button at the upper left of the Workspace. Note: everything in your Workspace will be published to the students' Resource Library tab. Make sure to tailor the Workspace to what you want to publish.
